010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012//import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.stat.correlation.Covariance;
014
015/**
016 * Utility class defines a few statistical methods.
017 * @author WB
018 *
019 */
020public abstract class Statistics {
021        
022        private Statistics() {}
023        
024        /**
025         * Calculates the covariance matrix for a sequence of sample vectors.
026         * Takes a sequence of n data samples, each of dimension m.
027         * The data element samples[i][j] refers to the j-th component
028         * of sample i. No statistical bias correction is applied.
029         * @param samples Array of m-dimensional vectors (double[n][m]).
030         * @return The covariance matrix (of dimension double{m][m]).
031         */
032        public static double[][] covarianceMatrix(double[][] samples) {
033                return covarianceMatrix(samples, false);
034        }
035        
036        /**
037         * Calculates the covariance matrix for a sequence of sample vectors.
038         * Takes a sequence of n data samples, each of dimension m.
039         * The data element samples[i][j] refers to the j-th component
040         * of sample i. No statistical bias correction is applied.
041         * @param samples Array of m-dimensional vectors (double[n][m]).
042         * @param biasCorrect If {@code true}, statistical bias correction is applied.
043         * @return The covariance matrix (of dimension double{m][m]).
044         */
045        public static double[][] covarianceMatrix(double[][] samples, boolean biasCorrect) {
046                Covariance cov = new Covariance(samples, biasCorrect);
047                return cov.getCovarianceMatrix().getData();
048        }
049        
050//      /** 
051//       * example from UTICS-C Appendix:
052//       * N = 4 samples
053//       * K = 3 dimensions
054//       * @param args ignored
055//       */
056//      public static void main(String[] args) {
057//              
058//              boolean BIAS_CORRECT = false;
059//              
060//              // example: n = 4 samples of dimension m = 3:
061//              // samples[i][j], i = column (sample index), j = row (dimension index).
062//              double[][] samples = { 
063//                              {75, 37, 12},   // i = 0
064//                              {41, 27, 20},   // i = 1
065//                              {93, 81, 11},   // i = 2
066//                              {12, 48, 52}    // i = 3
067//              };
068//              
069//              // covariance matrix Cov (3x3)
070//              double[][] cov = covarianceMatrix(samples, BIAS_CORRECT);
071//              System.out.println("cov = \n" + Matrix.toString(cov));
072//              
073//              System.out.println();
074//              
075//              double[][] icov = Matrix.inverse(cov);
076//              System.out.println("icov = \n" + Matrix.toString(icov));
077//              
078//              System.out.println();
079//              
080//              double trace = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(cov).getTrace();
081//              System.out.println("trace(cov) = " + trace);
082//              double Fnorm = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(cov).getFrobeniusNorm();
083//              System.out.println("Fnorm(cov) = " + Fnorm);
084//      }
085        
086/* Results (bias-corrected):
087cov = 
088{{1296.250, 442.583, -627.250}, 
089{442.583, 550.250, -70.917}, 
090{-627.250, -70.917, 370.917}}
091
092icov = 
093{{0.024, -0.014, 0.038}, 
094{-0.014, 0.011, -0.022}, 
095{0.038, -0.022, 0.063}}
096*/
097        
098/* verified with Mathematica
099X1 = {75, 37, 12}; X2 = {41, 27, 20}; X3 = {93, 81, 11}; X4 = {12, 48, 52};
100samples = {X1, X2, X3, X4}
101N[Covariance[samples]]
102-> {{1296.25, 442.583, -627.25}, {442.583, 550.25, -70.9167}, {-627.25, -70.9167, 370.917}}
103*/
104        
105/* Results (NON bias-corrected):
106cov = 
107{{972.188, 331.938, -470.438}, 
108{331.938, 412.688, -53.188}, 
109{-470.438, -53.188, 278.188}}
110
111icov = {{0.032, -0.019, 0.051}, 
112{-0.019, 0.014, -0.030}, 
113{0.051, -0.030, 0.083}}
114*/
115
116}
